sentences.english: He stayed in the hospital for half a year and returned home with a ruined face and a crippled leg.
sentences.chinese: 他在医院里呆了半年，回家时，脸面已毁，腿也跛了。

sentences.english: His crippled left leg makes him limp.
sentences.chinese: 他左腿跛了，走起路来一瘸一拐地。

sentences.english: He limped up the remaining three flights with tears in his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他眼里噙着眼泪，一跛一跛地走完了剩下的三节楼梯。

sentences.english: He limped up the remaining three flights with tears in his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他眼里噙着眼泪，一跛一跛地走完了剩下的三节楼梯。

sentences.english: He always limps along because he was injured in a traffic accident.
sentences.chinese: 他老是跛着脚行走，因他在一次交通事故中受过伤。

sentences.english: He is lame in the left leg and he walks lamely.
sentences.chinese: 他左腿跛了，走起路来一瘸一拐的。

sentences.english: The gimp went lamely around while whistling, informed us not to go to work.
sentences.chinese: 那个瘸子一瘸一跛地四处吹哨，通知说不出工。

sentences.english: He walks by a walking stick for he has one lame leg.
sentences.chinese: 他的一条腿跛了，走路借助于拐杖。

sentences.english: A student noticed Mr. Mill's left leg was lame.
sentences.chinese: 一个学生注意到米尔先生的左腿是跛的。

sentences.english: It would be easier for them to hobble to town with a broken leg than with a broken pantaloon .
sentences.chinese: 宁可跛了一条腿进城，他们也不肯穿着破裤子去。

sentences.english: Otherwise, rule of law will go lamely.
sentences.chinese: 否则，便是跛了脚的“法治”。

sentences.english: He is lame so he walks with a crutch.
sentences.chinese: 他的一条腿跛了，走路借助于拐杖。

sentences.english: Then he stood up and limped briskly toward the east exit.
sentences.chinese: 然后他站起来，跛着腿轻快地向东出口走去。

sentences.english: The lamb was lame in its lap.
The injured footballer limped slowly off the field.
sentences.chinese: 受伤的足球队员跛着脚慢慢走出埸地。

sentences.english: But in training Duff limps out early.
sentences.chinese: 可是练习场上，达夫早早地跛着退出了。

definition: to walk unsteadily/to stagger/to lurch/to hobble/to totter
to limp/to sprain (an ankle or wrist)/to move carefully, as if evading a danger/to scurry
to sprain (one's ankle)/see 崴子[wai3 zi5]
